sub_title: Education in Emergency Advisor at Plan International
summary: Since 2012 I have been working as Education in Emergencies Advisor at Plan International Ireland providing technical support to country teams. I have been deploying through Plan International Roster to support Country teams to respond to sudden onset disasters such as the Typhoon Haiyan in the Philippines and the Nepal Earthquake, complex emergencies and refugee crisis including the Syrian refugee response in Jordan and in Egypt, the Lake Chad crisis in Nigeria, the conflict in Central African Republic, the Malian Refugee Crisis (Northern Mali), the Rohingya Refugee response in Bangladesh. My last deployment has been to Moldova and Romania in February 2022 to support the Ukraine Refugee response. On behalf of Plan International, I co-chair the Global Education Cluster Cash task team and represent the organization in the INEE Accelerated Education working group. Before joining Plan Ireland’s team, I worked for various Italian NGOs by supporting programmes in the Balkans, DRC, Sri Lanka during the Tsunami Response and in the Middle East for five years.

profile_positions.description: I provide Education in Emergencies technical support to Plan’s Country teams in designing and implementing Education in emergencies programmes integrated with Child protection. Since October 2013 I have been deploying through Plan International Roster to support Country teams  to respond to sudden onset disasters such as the Typhoon Haiyan Response in the Philippines and the Nepal Earthquake emergency response, complex emergencies and refugee crisis including the Syrian refugee response in Jordan and in Egypt, the Lake Chad crisis  in Nigeria (Borno Sate), the conflict in Central African  Republic, the Malian  Refugee Crisis (Northern Mali))  and the Rohingya Refugee response in Bangladesh, the Ukraine Refugee crisis in Romania and Moldova. In Central African Republic,  in Jordan  and in Moldova I have supported Plan International to manage start-up operations and education-child protection integrated  programming and strategies.  Since 2015, I have been representing Plan International in the  INEE Accelerated Education working group and since 2019 I have been co-chairing on behalf of Plan International  the Global Education Cluster Cash Task team. Furthermore, since 2015 I have been providing  support to Plan’s  Global EIE roster and surge capacity, including through mentoring Country Based EiE specialist.
profile_positions.title: Education in Emergency Advisor

profile_positions.description: From May 2011 to February 2012 I worked as EIE project manager of a project titled: “Promoting psychosocial wellbeing and resilience of children and youth in the South of Gaza Strip”, funded by the Italian Cooperation (Emergency Programme AID9555). The project was implemented by EDUCAID in partnership with two Palestinian NGOs and targeted 10 educational centres/kindergarten located in remote areas of Rafah and Khan Younis Governorates – Gaza Strip.  Since April 2012 I also have acted as EDUCAID Country Representative in Israel and Occupied Palestinian Territories.  I was in charge of representing EDUCAID during institutional meetings with local authorities such as the Ministry of Social Affairs, the Ministry of Interior, the Ministry of Education, of coordinating EDUCAID strategic plan with  International Agencies  such as UNESCO, UNICEF and of dealing and negotiating with international donors such as the Italian Cooperation and the European Union. I coordinated the implementation of Educaid's educational and psychosocial support programme which included the areas of Jerusalem, West Bank and Gaza Strip.  I have written two  succesful project proposals one focused on the empowerment of disabled women through education and vocational training programmes in Gaza Strip which was funded by  the European Union (Investing in People) and one focused on the promotion of children's and youth's education and psychosocial wellbeing through active learning, networking and best practices sharing which was funded by the Italian Cooperation Emergency Programme (AID9775).

profile_positions.description: I developed an action plan focused on the promotion of children's and youth's rights, psychosocial wellbeing and education. I have conducted a child focused needs assessment both in the West Bank, and in Gaza Strip(Cast Lead Emergency response ), with the support of Palestinian grass roots associations and NGOs. As a result I wrote two project proposals that have been approved and funded by the European Union and by the Italian Cooperation, Emergency Programme. (total budget  Euro 737.000). I worked as project manager of a three years EU funded project called: "Promoting children, youth and women education and psychosocial wellbeing in Nablus (Old City)”. In addition I represented CISS in its participation in the Education cluster in OPT and I participated in the 2010 Consolidated Appeal Process workshops led by the Education Cluster.
